pullRequest.body:
This PR adds classes `ReflectsFiniteLimits`, `ReflectsFiniteProducts` and their duals, and relates them to existing classes.

It also cleans up the file `CategoryTheory.Limits.Preserves.Finite` a bit and removes some porting notes that are no longer relevant.

---
This is used in #12870 to prove that to check the coherent sheaf condition on a finitary extensive preregular category, it is enough to check after postcomposition with a finite-limit-reflecting functor.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7407f5dd-f358-4c02-b234-e234207026fd) for commit 369ce9f67187dae3ddad5922d0f7db3c05fedd06.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/bafd8ad4-724c-4687-88de-c18170776a5f) for commit 0f835ff535d8fa225897e8372b1d88d7922f84fd.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4e83c312-0db1-425e-a096-b9e2f4c76aa3/to/bafd8ad4-724c-4687-88de-c18170776a5f) against commit 75fbe69de08fd6936cfb1b6e4cf1832b4871b015.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: dagurtomas can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9095271071/job/24998125192)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9095271071/job/24998124668)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9095271071/job/24998124921)

This porting note was based on the misunderstanding that `PreservesColimitsOfSize0.preservesFiniteColimits` and `preservesFiniteColimitsOfPreservesFiniteColimitsOfSize` have anything to do with each other.
This porting note was based on the misunderstanding that `PreservesLimitsOfSize0.preservesFiniteLimits` and `preservesFiniteLimitsOfPreservesFiniteLimitsOfSize` have anything to do with each other.
Without this import change, this file doesn't know about the classes `HasFiniteLimits` and `HasFiniteProducts` etc.
I would suggest you try to remove it!
Ok, let's see what happens!
